ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:0.5_0: 69. The training rule on low seats
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting on low seats while giving teachings to people sitting on high seats.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.4_0: “How can the monks from the group of six sit on low seats while giving teachings to people sitting on high seats?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.8_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.11_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.12.1_0: “Once upon a time in Bārāṇasī, monks, there was a low-caste man whose wife became pregnant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.16_0: ‘But there are no mangoes. It’s the wrong season.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.17_0: ‘If I don’t get any, I’ll die.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.18_0: At that time the king had a mango tree that was always bearing fruit.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.19_0: Then that low-caste man went to that mango tree.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.19_1: She climbed it and hid himself.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.20_0: Just then the king and his brahmin counselor went to that same mango tree.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.20_1: She then sat down on a high seat while learning the Vedas.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.22_0: ‘How wrong-headed this king is, in that he sits on a high seat while learning the Vedas.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.23_0: And the brahmin is wrong-headed too, in that he sits on a low seat while teaching the the Vedas to one sitting on a high seat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.24_0: And I’m wrong-headed too, in that I steal mangoes from the king because of a woman.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.29_0: Not he who teaches the Vedas,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.30_0: and you can get harmed by the teaching.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.32_0: With a curry of pure meat:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.33_0: Therefore I’m not practicing the Teaching,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.34_0: The Teaching praised by the Noble Ones.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.35.1_0: ‘A curse it is the obtaining of wealth,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.36_0: And the obtaining of fame, too, brahmin;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.37_0: These things come with a low rebirth,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.40_0: Other beings will do the cooking;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.42_0: Because you’ll break like a jar.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.43_0: Even at that time, monks, I was displeased by someone teaching the Vedas while sitting on a low seat to someone sitting on a high seat. How, then, could it not be displeasing now?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.44_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.45_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.46.1_0: ‘“I will not give a teaching while sitting on a low seat to anyone sitting on a high seat who is not sick,” this is how you should train.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.47_0: One should not give a teaching while sitting on a low seat to anyone sitting on a high seat who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.48_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching while sitting on a low seat to someone sitting on a high seat who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.50.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.52_0: The ninth rule, the training rule on nine, is finished.
